page.title: 04Keswick's Launch Company.
page.content: The launch company was formed in 1935 by Victor Hodgson and Walter Walker. Six launches are now run on Derwent- Water.Nine men and two women work on the launches doing shifts in summer from the first Sunday in November to the middle of march.The company has been going for fifty years.The boatmen have heard a lot of funny stories like people reaching out for the landing stage and so pushing the boat away from the landing stage.As it gets further away from the stage they fall in. Originally people used to hire out their own boats.Then the May Queen came,she was a very big boat,she held upto seventy people.Her nick name was the Big Thief,because she stole other peoples business.The Annie Mellor was built in 1935 for Sir George Mellor and it was named after his sister.
